page.title: 11VIGO RUGBY FOOTBALL CLUB
page.content: Vigo R.F.C. is named after the local pub in which it was first formed in 1969. The posts were felled and trimmed elms, erected in the field behind the pub - the changing rooms were a disused poultry shed! By 1980 the club had raised enough money to build their own clubhouse on its present site with 3 pitches. They run 4 Saturday teams and an occasional Veterans side. They have a flourishing Colts team and in 1984 hosted the Kent Colts Championships. All these teams are fed by a thriving mini-rugby section, training on Sunday mornings. Many of the parents as well as local residents are social members of the club and appreciate the bar facilities, discos, barbeques and dances that are regularly held in the club house and on the field.
